verses.roman:
sakhyuḥ priyasya viprarṣer
aṅga-saṅgāti-nirvṛtaḥ
prīto vyamuñcad ab-bindūn
netrābhyāṁ puṣkarekṣaṇaḥ

synonyms: sakhyuḥ—of His friend; priyasya—dear; vipra-ṛṣeḥ—the sagacious brāhmaṇa; aṅga—of the body; saṅga—by the contact; ati—extremely; nirvṛtaḥ—ecstatic; prītaḥ—affectionate; vyamuñcat—He released; ap—of water; bindūn—drops; netrābhyām—from His eyes; puṣkara-īkṣaṇaḥ—the lotus-eyed Personality of Godhead.
translation: The lotus-eyed Supreme Lord felt intense ecstasy upon touching the body of His dear friend, the wise brāhmaṇa, and thus He shed tears of love.
